prior_works.title: DiffLinker: Equivariant 3D-Conditional Diffusion for Molecular Linker Design
prior_works.role: Immediate methodological precursor for 3D linker generation
prior_works.relationship_sentence: DiffLinker introduced E(3)-equivariant diffusion to generate 3D linkers conditional on fixed fragment poses; LinkerNet generalizes this setup by simultaneously inferring fragment poses and generating the linker within a unified equivariant diffusion process.

prior_works.title: DiffDock: Diffusion Steps, Twists, and Turns for Molecular Docking
prior_works.authors: Gabriele Corso, Hannes Stärk, Bowen Jing, Regina Barzilay, Tommi Jaakkola
prior_works.role: Pose diffusion on SE(3) and torsional manifolds
prior_works.relationship_sentence: DiffDock demonstrated how to perform equivariant diffusion over rigid-body poses and internal torsions when the ligand pose is unknown, directly informing LinkerNet’s treatment of fragment pose inference coupled with 3D structure generation.

prior_works.title: E(n) Equivariant Diffusion Models
prior_works.authors: Emiel Hoogeboom, Victor Garcia Satorras, Jakub M. Tomczak, Max Welling
prior_works.role: Foundational framework for equivariant diffusion in Euclidean space
prior_works.relationship_sentence: This work established the general recipe for E(n)-equivariant score/diffusion modeling of point clouds, providing the theoretical and algorithmic backbone for LinkerNet’s 3D equivariant diffusion over linker atom coordinates.

prior_works.title: EGNN: E(n) Equivariant Graph Neural Networks
prior_works.authors: Victor Garcia Satorras, Emiel Hoogeboom, Max Welling
prior_works.role: Core equivariant architecture for learning coordinate updates
prior_works.relationship_sentence: EGNN introduced lightweight E(n)-equivariant message passing to predict coordinate velocities/forces, a design that underlies LinkerNet’s learned updates for atom positions and informs its Newton–Euler-inspired rigid-body pose updates for fragments.

prior_works.title: SE(3)-Transformers: 3D Roto-Translation Equivariant Attention Networks
prior_works.authors: Fabian B. Fuchs, Daniel E. Worrall, Volker Fischer, Max Welling
prior_works.relationship_sentence: By formalizing SE(3)-equivariant attention over geometric data, this work helped establish architectural principles that LinkerNet leverages to maintain exact equivariance while jointly modeling fragment poses and linker geometry.

prior_works.title: DeLinker: A Generative Model for Fragment Linking and Scaffold Hopping
prior_works.role: Problem setup and baseline for fragment linking with known poses
prior_works.relationship_sentence: DeLinker crystallized the fragment-linking task but required prearranged fragment geometry; LinkerNet removes this assumption by learning fragment poses and the linker concurrently, expanding the problem scope to realistic unknown-pose settings.

synthesis_narrative:
LinkerNet’s core innovation—co-designing fragment poses and a 3D linker via an E(3)-equivariant diffusion process—builds directly on three converging lines of prior work. First, fragment-linking methods such as DeLinker formalized the task but assumed pre-positioned fragments, motivating a model that can handle unknown relative poses. DiffLinker advanced the methodology by introducing E(3)-equivariant diffusion to generate 3D linkers conditioned on fixed fragment coordinates; LinkerNet explicitly generalizes DiffLinker’s conditional generation to the harder joint problem of pose inference and linker construction.
Second, recent progress on equivariant diffusion and architectures made such a joint model feasible. E(n) Equivariant Diffusion Models provided the principled framework for noise schedules and score matching in Euclidean coordinates with strict equivariance, while EGNN and SE(3)-Transformers supplied practical, expressive equivariant backbones to predict coordinate and pose updates without breaking symmetry.
Third, DiffDock showed how to perform diffusion over rigid-body SE(3) poses and internal torsions when the pose is unknown, a blueprint that LinkerNet adapts to multi-fragment systems. LinkerNet’s Newton–Euler-inspired module for fragment pose updates recasts fragments as rigid bodies with learned force/torque-like updates, marrying DiffDock’s pose-diffusion insight with EGNN-style coordinate dynamics. Together, these works directly informed LinkerNet’s unified, equivariant generative process that simultaneously resolves fragment placement and synthesizes chemically plausible 3D linkers.
